conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph and tangent lines to understand acceleration.
Identify tangent lines at points A and B on the velocity-time graph.
Tangent at point A is steepest, indicating highest velocity.
Tangent at point B is steepest, indicating lowest velocity.
Direction of tangent lines: steeper at point A means object A is accelerating upward.
Steeper at point B means object B is accelerating downward.
Object at point A is accelerating faster than object at point B, indicating increasing acceleration from 0 to t1.
Object at point B is accelerating faster than object at point A, indicating decreasing acceleration from t1 to t.
Acceleration of both objects is first increasing and then decreasing from 0 to t1.
